intro: Stenogyne cranwelliae, commonly known as the Kauai mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is an endemic species, found only on the island of Kauai, and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of the region. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened and is protected under conservation efforts.
